ï»¿STAI UTORY COMMITTEE REPORf-- TO: The President, Internation I Bank for Reconstruction and Development Report of the Committee i nder Section 4 (iii) ofArticle III of the Articles ofAgreement on the proposed Loans (P Foor-Ouarzazate Concentrated Solar Power Plant Project) to the Moroccan Agency for Solar Energy to be guaranteed by the Kingdom ofMorocco The undersigned Committ ,e constituted under Section 7 of Article V of the Articles of Agreement of the International B?Lnk for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) hereby submits its report pursuant to Se:tion 4 (iii) of Article III of said Articles in respect of the proposal that the Bank grant to M(roccan Agency for Solar Energy (the Borrower) a loan (IBRD Loan) in an amount of: (a) twc hundred thirty four million five hundred thousand Euros, (E234,500,000); and (b) eighty million Dollars, ($80,000,000), to be guaranteed by the Kingdom of Morocco. The purpose of said loan is to increase: (a) installed capacity (megawatt); and (b) electricity output (megawatt-hour', especially during peak hours, of the Noor-Ouarzazate Solar Complex. The Project will also be si ipported by a loan from the Clean Technology Fund (CTF) in an amount of one hundred ninet(en million Dollars ($119,000,000) (referred to as the "CTF Loan"), with the guarantee of the 1, ingdom of Morocco. 1. The Committee has carefully studied the merits of the proposal to grant such IBRD Loan and CTF Loan, and of the purpose to which the proceeds of the IBRD Loan and the CTF Loan are to be applied. 2. The Committee is of the )pinion that the Project toward the financing of which the proceeds of such loans are to be Lpplied comes within the purposes of the Bank as set forth in Article I of said Articles of Ag reement, and that said Project is designed to promote the development of the productive facilities and resources of the Kingdom of Morocco and is in the interest of the Kingdom of Morocco and of the members of the Bank as a whole.
ï»¿KINGDOM OF MOROCCO -2- Noor-Ouarzazate Concentrated Solar Power Plant Project 3. Accordingly, the Committe, finds that said Project merits financial assistance from the Bank, and hereby recommends said Project for such assistance. COMMITTEE Senior Vice President and Group General Counsel Expert Selected by Governor for Kingdom of Morocco Regional Vice resident Middle East and North Africa Dated at Washington, D.C.
